item.title: Decentralized ML: Experiments on Topology and Privacy
item.author: Author
item.description: Decentralized machine learning is an important type of machine learning used to address problems such as data locality, ownership, privacy and high communication costs. We contribute an empirical evaluation of the impact of topology and differential privacy on model convergence and error in a decentralized learning system.
